data.title: La Brea: Everything to Know For Final Season: Trailer, How to Watch and More
data.meta_description: Check out the first trailer for La Brea's third and final season.
data.text:
We have everything you need to know — so far— about La Brea Season 3 ahead. As the show heads into its final season with aims to wrap everything up in just six episodes, here's what you need to know to get ready.

When does La Brea Season 3 premiere?

La Brea Season 3 premieres Tuesday, January 9 at 9/8c. It will then air Tuesdays at 9/8c on NBC and next day on Peacock. This will be the show's final season.

Is there a La Brea Season 3 trailer?

Yes! Check out the first full trailer for the third and final season of La Brea below. The footage is some of the wildest action we've seen yet from the series, featuring dinosaurs and teasing answers to plenty of long-running questions as the series looks to wrap up its storyline once and for all.

The network has also, previously released a teaser for the new season. You can check it out below:

RELATED: La Brea Season 2 Finale: All Your Questions, Answered by the Show Creator

Which cast members will return to the show?

The only major change is that former cast member Natalie Zea who plays Eve Harris will have a much reduced presence in Season 3. Eve stepped into a portal in the Season 2 finale which explains why we won't see her much until the finale episodes. Otherwise, there have been no changes announced regarding the status of the current ensemble cast including: Eoin Macken, Jon Seda, Nicholas Gonzalez, Chiké Okonkwo, Zyra Gorecki, Jack Martin, Veronica St. Clair, Rohan Mirchandaney, Lily Santiago, Josh McKenzie, Tonantzin Carmelo, and Michelle Vergara Moore.

RELATED: Is La Brea a Real Place?

What will happen in Season 3?

Show creator David Appelbaum told NBC Insider in December that, "I always had an idea of where I wanted to end it for certain characters. But some of the other characters were on a different different journey in Season 2, so we really approached it from where do we want to bring all the characters emotionally by the end of the season?"

He said there will be major plots involving the pregnancy of Lucas and Veronica, exploring, "What does it mean to potentially become parents in 10,000 B.C.?" and a resolution to the Harris family being split apart once more.
